bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Albert E. Truby, August 19, 1941

div1.p: Kean informs Truby that the inscription on the Reed bust has been removed due to objections by the Cubans. Kean offers his opinion of Dominguez' biography of Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Albert E. Truby, August 19, 1941

opener.dateline:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
Aug. 19, 1941

div1.p:
It is pleasant to get your
letter of the 11th and have news
of you- It was a pleasant
surprise when that dear wife
of yours walked in the back
gate and found me sitting on
the terrace- It was very short
tho. and I had not asked her
half the things I wanted to
know when the thunder growled
and she said she had to run
along, tho we would have loved
to keep her to dinner-

Yes I found out all about the Schuler
bust- There is no inscription under
it now, but when I got hold of the
2
Aug 19, 1941
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
curator of the Old Museum building where
it had been before you took it out to
Walter Reed, he had a record of the
inscription which had been on
the pedestal- It was just what the
Cubans had complained about
“that discovered and demonstrated
in 1901 the transmission of yellow
fever by mosquitos”- It is the word
discovered that they object to and
justly I think- Demonstrated is
unquestioned- I wrote to Dr. Fran-
cisco Dominguez Roldan that that
inscription had been removed
seven years ago- His biography of-
Finlay was published in 1933 for his
centennial. It is nearly 300 pages
3
Aug 19,1941
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
in French and very well written-
Though there is much special plead-
ing and some distortion of facts-
If you read French easily and want to
read I will send it to you-
Of course I want to read your
story- I am just sitting around
waiting for it- We will let Gen-
Lawrence Reed it if you wish after
Ireland and I are thru with it-
Yes the late Dr Goldberger of the P.H.S.
was the one who said said “that
Reed's work had converted a discredited
hypothesis into an established doctrine”
That is the best answer to Dr Dominquez
300 pages of excellent French-
I have a little blank book 9"x5 1/2"
in which for years I have copied
4
Aug 19, 1941
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
references and short quotations and
it is now a little thesaurus, like a bag of
gems all mixed up- It always amused
Winter with the odd references he
would find in it- One of the last things
I wrote in it was a brief account of the
dinner gotten up by Guiteras of some 60
of the prominent doctors of Havana to
celebrate the demonstration by the Reed
Board of the Finlay theory- It was on
Dec. 22, 1900 Reed his two assistants Gorgas
Gen. Wood and I were there- Dr. Domin-
guez gives a full account of it in his book
and says that Dr. Guiteras was sent by
Gen. Wood to ask him to take charge
of it and be the toast master- That is a
little different from my recollection but
it may be true-

I do not believe that Dr. Hench was at all
offended at your comments on the Hem-
meter photostats tho. some of them were a
surprise to him as they were to me-
5
Aug 19, 1941
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
But Hench is, I think, only anxious to
bring out the truth in a fair scientific
spirit and he is not is the business
of making heroes- He has more-
over much human charity and
bears with philosophy the evidence
of human weaknesses vanity, jea-
lousy and twisting of the facts which
he comes across in his painstaking
sifting of all the evidence- I was
surprised to find how often I had to
answer “I do not know” to questions
that I might reasonably be supposed
to know- I saw a good deal of Agra-
monte in the second Cuban Intervention
and formed a better opinion of him
than you have, but that does not
make me object in any way to the
opinions which you have formed on
good grounds- If Hench has not written
(over)
C2
B5
6
to you lately it has just happened
so I am sure-

Have you seen the colored reproduc-
tion of Cornwell's picture “the Conquerors
of Yellow Fever-” Mrs. Leonard Wood
sent us a copy of it as printed in
the New York Mirror- I did not think
it desirable to introduce so many
figures but I must say that the
artist has been more successful
than I thought possible- I believe
that it is to be printed in color
with Hench's address at the unveiling
of it at Cleveland - in the
A. M. A. Medical Magazine Hygeia for
October- He has you there peeking
over Agramonte's shoulder-so you
must get a copy of it.

I had another visit from Miss Laura
Wood- She tells me that her grandfather
see back of page 4
7
came from Albemarle Co, Va- a well known
family there, and she is a very intel-
ligent woman- She told Cornelia
that she was married but prefers
in her literary work to use her
maiden name-

When you write to Mrs Truby please
tell her that when there is some
interesting news I would like to
hear it- I thought that you
were coming on, this month-
div1.closer:
Cordially your friend J. R. Kean Didnt you know Percy Jones, we went
to his funeral last week- A very
jolly companion- Riescat in pace
